content:
in the original argument. Another reason is
that any precedent can be overturned. Precedents are not supposed to be
overturned unless they are very badly mistaken or immoral, but this is al-
ways a possibility. Nonetheless, even though arguments from precedents
always might be refuted in such ways, precedents can still provide reasons
for legal decisions.
So far we have looked at arguments from precedents as ways to deter-
mine what is necessary or sufficient to violate the law. Even after this
